neighbors.name: Call Farms, Inc.
neighbors.claims: Call Farms, Inc. (affiliated with My-T Acres, Inc.) is a major family farm enterprise operating approximately 8,500 acres across Genesee, Orleans, and Livingston counties, producing chip potatoes, sweet corn, peas, and other crops ([Farm Credit East](https://www.farmcrediteast.com/-/media/farm-credit-east/director-elections/Letters/2019/Call_candidateletter2019.ashx?la=en)). The business is led by the Call family, notably Peter R. Call, and has been a prominent vegetable and grain farming operation in Western New York since the late 1970s ([Seneca Foods](https://www.senecafoods.com/leadership-team)). Call Farms, Inc. is a participating landowner in Hecate Energy’s 500 MW Cider Solar project, with active leases on multiple parcels ([DPS NY](https://documents.dps.ny.gov/public/Common/ViewDoc.aspx?DocRefId={C04B4D91-0000-C72D-923C-C58FC173D7D1}&DocTitle=AttB_CSF_LandAgreementSummary)). Additionally, the entity actively develops solar on its own land, having applied for a Special Use Permit in 2023 to construct the "Oak Orchard Solar 3" 5 MW community solar project on a 20.6-acre portion of its property in the Town of Batavia ([Genesee County Planning](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/sharedassets/county/v/1/planning/refer/t-01-bat-01-23.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: High – Major regional landowner (8,500 acres) and employer; principal Peter R. Call holds significant leadership roles including Cornell University Trustee, Director at Seneca Foods, and Director at Farm Credit East, indicating deep institutional connections.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Peter R. Call directly; acknowledge his leadership in the agricultural sector (Cornell, Farm Credit) and the farm's active participation in both utility-scale (Cider Solar) and community solar (Oak Orchard) projects.

citations.claim: Call Farms, Inc. (affiliated with My-T Acres, Inc.) is a major family farm enterprise operating approximately 8,500 acres... producing chip potatoes, sweet corn, peas, and other crops

neighbors.name: Norton Farms Inc
neighbors.claims: Norton Farms Inc is a New York dairy farm corporation based in Elba, NY, operating at 6274 Oak Orchard Road ([Genesee County](https://townofelba.prosgar.com/PROSParcel/Parcel/1177?swis=183489)). The farm actively milks approximately 645 head of cattle and produces around 40,000 pounds of milk per day, selling to the Lactalis Group ([Genesee County Ag Protection Board](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). Norton Farms controls significant acreage in the Oakfield–Elba area and is a participating landowner in the Cider Solar project, having executed a lease agreement with Hecate Energy in January 2023 ([DPS NY](https://documents.dps.ny.gov/public/Common/ViewDoc.aspx?DocRefId={C04B4D91-0000-C72D-923C-C58FC173D7D1}&DocTitle=AttB_CSF_LandAgreementSummary)). The farm's participation in the project indicates a supportive commercial stance toward renewable energy development ([DPS NY](https://documents.dps.ny.gov/public/Common/ViewDoc.aspx?DocRefId={C04B4D91-0000-C72D-923C-C58FC173D7D1}&DocTitle=AttB_CSF_LandAgreementSummary)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Medium – Significant local dairy operation (645 head of cattle) and large landholder participating in the Cider Solar project; influence is primarily within the local agricultural sector.

approach_recommendations.engage: Maintain close communication with the Norton family regarding construction logistics near their active dairy operations; validate their supportive stance evidenced by their executed lease agreement.
